message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a high-quality item at a competitive price. I'm willing to offer it to you for $14,000.

Thanks for the offer, Alice. While I appreciate the opportunity, $14,000 is a bit higher than I'm willing to go right now. I'm interested in the product, but I'm only able to offer $11,000 at this time. Let's see if we can find some common ground.

Thanks for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $11,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $13,000. This is the best I can do for now.
Alice, I understand your position, but $13,000 is still a bit more than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to go up to $11,500. This is my final offer, and I believe it's a fair compromise.

I understand that you're trying to find a sweet spot, Bob. However, I'm still not comfortable going below $13,000. I'm willing to make a slight concession, so I'm counteroffering at $12,800. This is as low as I can go.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to come down a bit. However, $12,800 is still a little more than I'm ready to spend. I'm going to stick with my previous offer of $11,500.  Let's see if we can make this work.

Bob, I understand you're trying to get a good deal, but I'm starting to think we're getting close to the minimum I'm willing to accept. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm counteroffering at $12,200. This is as low as I can go, and I'm hoping we can finally come to an agreement.
